Class EndPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • EndPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class EndPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Version:
    2.0, June 11, 2014 The purpose of this program is to deal with the level completion screen. The level completion screen will display a unique background and various pieces of information informing player of their current score. (Lives, difficulty bonus, steps taken, etc.)

    Variable Dictionary
    Name Type Purpose
    layout SpringLayout Gives program access to methods and variables of SpringLayout.
    nextLevel JButton Button associated to allowing player to continue to next level.
    g GamePanel Gives program access to methods and variables of GamePanel.
    difficulty int Stores the level of difficulty.
    score int Stores the player score.
    h HighScorePanel Gives program access to methods and variables of HighScorePanel.
    f Main Gives program access to Main frame.
    scoring JLabel[][] A series of labels containing information on how the scoring was done that are to be placed on the screen.
    title JLabel A label that stores the title of the screen.
    image Image Stores the background image.
    d JDialog Gives program access to methods and variables of JDialog.
    inputField JTextField Variable associated to portion of code that allows user to enter in name (if required).

    Author:
    Daniel Chen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • EndPanel

        public EndPanel(HighScorePanel highScorePanel,
        Main frame)
        Sets up the panel and its components. The background image is read in, the preferred size of this panel is determined, layout manager is created, the buttons created, positioned, and ActionListeners (this) attached. The JLabels that displays the user's score is also created and positioned.

        Loops and Conditions
        for (... The purpose of this loop is to simplify the code that formats the screen. (Constraints on the labels.)

        Parameters:
        back - Button associated to allowing the user to return to menu.
        highScorePanel - The panel in charge of displaying and updating the high scores.
        frame - The JFrame that this panel is part of.

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public void display(java.lang.String text)
        Called when the user failed to pass a level. Only the previous level's score is accounted for and everything else is 0. The continue to next level button is not shown.
        Parameters:
        text - The string to display at the top (either Chickened out or Level failed

      • display

        public void display(int[] mazeData,
           int lives,
           int difficulty,
           GamePanel game)
        Displays the user's score for the level. The user's score is calculated using the shortest distance to the exit from the entrance divided by their steps multiplied by 100 and and bonuses. The level bonus is the difficulty of the level times 50 (easy = 0, hard = 2), the amount of lives they have left over is multiplied by 20 to get the lives bonus. As the user's scores and bonuses are displayed, if the user is on hard, the continue to next level button will not be shown. Updates the user's score.

        Loops and Conditions
        if (difficul... The purpose of this structure is to check which level of difficulty to display.

        Parameters:
        mazeData - Int array containg the amount of steps the user has taken and the shortest amount of steps to the exit.
        lives - The amount of lives the user has at the end of the level.
        difficulty - The difficulty of the maze.
        game - Gives access to the methods of the GamePanel that called this method.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Method for handling button commands. If the user pressed the Continue to Next Level button, a maze with an increased difficulty will be generated. If the user pressed the Return to Main Menu button, it will prompt the user to enter their names if they have beaten high score. They will get the choice to not enter their name, enter their name, or not go back to the main menu (if they pressed by mistake. If the user pressed Enter or Cancel (from the JDialog prompting them to enter their names) the JDialog will be removed. If the user pressed Enter, if their name is valid (not blank), the high score will be updated and the user will be shown the high scores screen. If the name is blank, the user will be informed that they cannot enter blank. If the user pressed cancel, it will return to the main menu.

        Loops and Conditions
        if (ae.get...("Continue to Next Level")) The purpose of this structure is to check if the user has selected to continue to the next level or not.
        if (score != 0 && h.get... The purpose of this structure is to check if the user has beaten a high score or not.
        switch (JOptionPane... The purpose of this structure is to check if the player would like to be entered to the high scores or not.
        if (inputField... The purpose of this structure is to check if the name box is empty or not.
        if (ae.getActionCommand... The purpose of this structure is to check if the user selects to cancel or not. (Cancel entering their name and entering the high scores list.)

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - The ActionEvent that is generated.
